meanings.definition: A group of countries, parties, or individuals with common interests or goals.
meanings.sent1: The trade blocs worked together to boost their economies.
meanings.sent2: The Eastern and Western blocs were formed during the Cold War.
meanings.sent3: The blocs decided to have a picnic to discuss their trade agreements.
meanings.sent4: The blocs stood tall like mighty towers, united in purpose.
meanings.sent5: The colorful blocs of countries painted a vibrant picture of cooperation.

meanings.definition: A group of voters or politicians who share common interests and vote together.
meanings.sent1: The voting blocs supported the new education bill.
meanings.sent2: The environmental blocs in parliament pushed for stricter regulations.
meanings.sent3: The blocs had a friendly competition to see who could gather the most votes.
meanings.sent4: The blocs were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent5: The powerful blocs of voters made their voices heard in the election.
